definition: to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: He ordered the cortege to stop.
A few months later, the king and his men went hunting.
sentences.chinese: 几个月后，国王和他的随从们去打猎。

sentences.english: The prophets prophesied by Baal, following worthless idols .
sentences.chinese: 先知借巴力说预言，随从无益的神。

sentences.english: At least 15 of Miss Bhutto’s followers were also killed.
sentences.chinese: 至少15位布托的随从也遭袭身亡。

sentences.english: No longer will they follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他们必不再随从自己顽梗的恶心行事。

sentences.english: That he'd been murdered by a member of his own entourage.
sentences.chinese: 他是被自己的一名随从谋杀的。

sentences.english: Added new system Traits and Ancillaries.
sentences.chinese: 增加了新的人物属性和随从。

sentences.english: The king desired to visit it, and ordered the attendants to drive up to the gates.
sentences.chinese: 他非常想去拜访一下，就令随从驾车来到了大门。

sentences.english: He was so impressed by your wondrous palaces that he and his retinue swore their allegiances to you.
sentences.chinese: 他被你辉煌的宫殿深深震撼，率领他的随从向你效忠。

sentences.english: But they have already set their sights on some in his entourage.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们已经将注意力投向他的某些随从人员。

sentences.english: Jeroboam enticed Israel away from following the Lord and caused them to commit a great sin.
sentences.chinese: 耶罗波安引诱以色列人不随从耶和华，陷在大罪里。

sentences.english: Criminal Damdeok and his followers should hand over all their armors .
sentences.chinese: 罪人谈德和他的随从必须交出武器。

sentences.english: The prince and his attendants arrived in the city.
sentences.chinese: 王子及其随从人员已到达该城。

sentences.english: Wherever she went she was attended on by a large number of followers and servants.
sentences.chinese: 不管她走到哪里，随从和佣人都是前呼后拥的。

sentences.english: From a follower to leader, I learned a lot - to lead and to contribute, said Han Tianyu, who is now a student at Case Western Reserve University.
sentences.chinese: 从随从到领导，我学到了很多。

sentences.english: He came out with a troop of followers.
sentences.chinese: 他带着一大群随从走出来。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
(old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc
defense of the imperial palace or of the capital/the palace guard (or a member of that unit)
